soft_skills.name: Discipline
soft_skills.description: The ability to maintain self-control and adhere to rules or standards.

questions.question: Having strict discipline always means obeying without thinking.
What does having strict personal discipline mean?
options: Waking up at dawn every day.
Following rules to stay focused and organized.
Writing a book on the art of procrastination.
Doing your best to meet your commitments.

questions.question: In which field, aside from the military, do you consider discipline as a very important criterion?

soft_skills.name: Team Spirit
soft_skills.description: The ability to work collectively for the benefit of the group.

questions.question: Team spirit means working for the benefit of the team rather than for individual interests.
Team spirit is demonstrated when a team:
options: Shares responsibilities and supports each other.
Organizes a surprise birthday party.
Works separately without speaking to each other.
Spends time singing group songs.

questions.question: In your opinion, in which professional sector is team spirit most important?

soft_skills.name: Ability to Execute Orders Efficiently
soft_skills.description: Carrying out orders quickly and accurately while understanding their purpose.

questions.question: Executing an order quickly always means acting without asking questions.
What does 'executing an order quickly' mean?
options: Running fast with a piece of paper.
Acting efficiently while understanding the order.
Doing something randomly to save time.
Waiting for someone else to do it for you.

questions.question: Can you give an example where it is essential to respond as quickly as possible?

soft_skills.name: Risk Management in Operations
soft_skills.description: Identifying, assessing, and mitigating potential risks in operations.

questions.question: Risk management is about eliminating all potential hazards.
Risk management involves:
options: Ignoring all problems and hoping everything will be fine.
Analyzing potential hazards and planning solutions.
Wearing a helmet even to go to the supermarket.
Completely avoiding dangerous situations.

questions.question: Can you provide an example of a situation where it's important to anticipate risks in advance?

soft_skills.name: Precision in Mission Execution
soft_skills.description: The ability to complete tasks accurately and effectively according to instructions.

questions.question: Precision in a mission only means completing the task quickly.
Being precise in a mission means:
options: Following instructions to the letter.
Doing things without asking questions.
Wearing a watch to avoid being late.
Letting someone else manage the details.

questions.question: In which field is the need for precision most important?

soft_skills.name: Mental and Physical Resilience
soft_skills.description: The capacity to recover and adapt in challenging situations, both mentally and physically.

questions.question: Mental resilience is more important than physical resilience.
How can you develop good mental and physical resilience?
options: By reading Rich Dad Poor Dad.
By combining regular exercise and stress management.
By eating only proteins.
By sleeping all day to recharge.

questions.question: Which do you think is more important to develop, physical or mental resilience?

soft_skills.name: Decision-making in Unknown Terrain
soft_skills.description: The ability to make effective decisions in unfamiliar or unpredictable situations.

questions.question: Making decisions in unknown terrain always requires following rigid procedures.
What does making a decision in unknown terrain mean?
options: Thinking calmly and adapting to the situation.
Drawing a map on the spot to get oriented.
Waiting for someone else to give instructions.
Relying only on luck.

questions.question: Which country would you least want to end up in unintentionally?

soft_skills.name: Stress Management in Conflict Zones
soft_skills.description: The ability to remain calm and manage stress effectively in high-pressure situations.

questions.question: Managing stress means avoiding all negative emotions.
How can you better manage stress in a difficult situation?
options: By breathing deeply and staying focused.
By playing Call of Duty.
By immediately abandoning the situation.
By ignoring completely what's happening.

questions.question: What is the best technique to stay calm in everyday challenges, such as traffic jams or tight deadlines?

soft_skills.name: Ability to Follow Safety Protocols
soft_skills.description: Understanding and adhering to safety procedures to prevent harm and ensure operational effectiveness.

questions.question: Following safety protocols is optional.
Why is it important to follow safety protocols?
options: To prevent accidents and protect people involved.
To avoid getting scolded by your superior.
Because the game's name is Protocol 55.
Because everyone loves rules.

questions.question: Can you give an example of a situation where following safety protocols is essential, even in daily life?

soft_skills.name: Observation Skills in Complex Environments
soft_skills.description: The ability to notice, interpret, and prioritize critical details in challenging situations.

questions.question: Having a good sense of observation means only noticing the big details.
How can you improve your sense of observation?
options: By developing your Sharingan.
By practicing attention to detail in simple activities.
By taking compulsive notes.
By looking at things once and assuming the rest.

questions.question: If you had to keep only one sense out of the five (sight, smell, hearing, touch, taste), which would you keep?

soft_skills.name: Ability to Stay Focused Under Pressure
soft_skills.description: The capacity to maintain concentration and effectively handle stress in demanding situations.

questions.question: You can only stay focused under pressure by being naturally calm.
Which strategy helps you stay focused in a stressful situation?
options: Remembering the main goal and breaking the problem into steps.
Thinking about the next meal break.
Looking around to see what others are doing.
Trying to forget the pressure completely.

questions.question: What do you think is the most effective way to stay focused when there are distractions around you?

soft_skills.name: Leadership in Extreme Conditions
soft_skills.description: Guiding and supporting a team to achieve objectives during challenging circumstances.

questions.question: Being a good leader in extreme conditions always means leading without consulting your team.
Good leadership in extreme conditions includes:
options: Giving orders while shouting loudly.
Supporting the team and adapting to circumstances.
Doing nothing to see how the team reacts.
Focusing only on rules without considering the situation.

questions.question: In your opinion, what quality is most important to lead a group in a difficult situation?

soft_skills.name: Quick Resolution of Tactical Issues
soft_skills.description: Rapidly assessing and solving operational challenges with logical and effective actions.

questions.question: Solving a tactical problem quickly always means choosing the first solution that comes to mind.
A good quick tactical resolution involves:
options: Asking everyone's opinion without making a decision.
Sneaking away quietly.
Taking a long time to reflect.
Analyzing options quickly and acting logically.

questions.question: When facing an unexpected problem, what is the best way to find a solution quickly?

soft_skills.name: Ability to Integrate into Multinational Teams
soft_skills.description: Collaborating effectively with team members from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds.

questions.question: Integrating into a multinational team only means speaking multiple languages.
How can you better integrate into a multinational team?
options: By respecting cultural differences and being open to different viewpoints.
By imposing your own traditions on the team.
By drinking the strongest alcohol from your teammate's country.
By avoiding any interaction to avoid mistakes.

questions.question: In your mind, where would the person you would have the hardest time working with come from?

soft_skills.name: Flexibility in Changing Environments
soft_skills.description: Adapting to new challenges and dynamic situations with agility and composure.

questions.question: Being flexible means never planning anything.
What does being flexible in a changing environment mean?
options: Adapting quickly to new situations and adjusting plans.
Complaining until things return to normal.
Doing yoga to stay zen.
Refusing any change and sticking to the initial plan.

questions.question: In which field would you least like to work, even for just one day?

soft_skills.name: Ability to Handle Specialized Equipment
soft_skills.description: Using and maintaining equipment effectively to ensure safety and efficiency.

questions.question: Handling specialized equipment only requires using it without maintenance.
Why is it important to properly handle specialized equipment?
options: To ensure proper functioning and avoid accidents.
Because it costs a lot and needs to look nice.
To impress colleagues with your expertise.
Because machines are always reliable and never break down.

questions.question: What specialized equipment do you think you'll least need to use once in your life?

soft_skills.name: Adaptability to Local Cultures During International Missions
soft_skills.description: The ability to understand, respect, and adjust to local customs and practices during missions abroad.

questions.question: Adapting to a local culture means completely changing your own values.
Why is adapting to local cultures important during international missions?
options: To better communicate and cooperate with local people.
To criticize the local ways of doing things.
To blend in and disappear from the scene.
To impose your culture on others.

questions.question: What are the local habits or customs you'd like to adopt in a country you visit?

soft_skills.name: Ability to Build Trust in Tense Contexts
soft_skills.description: Building mutual trust through transparency and respect, even in challenging situations.

questions.question: Trust in a tense context is built solely through verbal promises.
How can trust be built in a tense situation?
options: By making a promise and crossing your fingers discreetly.
By showing transparency, listening, and respect.
By avoiding any discussion with others.
By imposing your decisions without explanation.

questions.question: In which area can trust be built in a tense situation?

soft_skills.name: Analytical Mindset for Military Strategies
soft_skills.description: The ability to analyze data and develop effective strategies in military contexts.

questions.question: An analytical mindset always involves choosing the simplest solution.
What does having an analytical mindset in a strategic context mean?
options: Drawing an unnecessarily complicated diagram to impress others.
Always choosing the most expensive option.
Being able to assess data and propose suitable solutions.
Following only the advice of superiors without reflection.

questions.question: If you were in the military, what do you think would be the most important factor to consider when analyzing a strategy in an uncertain environment?

soft_skills.name: Ability to Maintain Morale in Difficult Conditions
soft_skills.description: Keeping spirits high and fostering optimism during challenging times.

questions.question: Maintaining morale means avoiding any discussion of problems.
How can morale be maintained in difficult conditions?
options: By encouraging others and finding positive aspects in the situation.
By offering cookies to everyone.
By completely ignoring difficulties.
By focusing only on one's own emotions.

questions.question: When going through a difficult time, what action or attitude helps you the most to stay optimistic and motivated?
